reviews.title: Great sound and atmosphere
text: This concert venue, set in a beautiful heritage building, has a lot of charm. The sound quality on the first floor was excellent, even under the balcony, and the standing-room setup worked well. A thoughtful touch was the staff making accommodations for people with disabilities by providing chairs.

Some areas of the venue are less accessible, like the bathrooms in the basement, which are reached via narrow staircases and tight hallways that can’t always fit two people side by side. The bathroom attendant handing out soap and towels for tips felt unnecessary.
On a positive note, getting in and out of the building was very smooth, even with coat check.

One area that could be improved: the show I attended started almost an hour late, and there were no announcements explaining the delay. Many people in line were confused and unsure of what was happening. A little communication would go a long way!

reviews.title: Classic venue!
text: A classic, cool looking venue. Lots has been filmed here including What We Do In The Shadows. A very old venue, but so loved. The sound is good, I’ve seen so many shows here and was even lucky enough to perform here opening up for All That Remains! Great memories are made here!

reviews.title: great venue to attend shows
text: best rock n roll metal evening ever..nice staff..cozy venue and easy to get to. drinks fair price...

reviews.title: Great evening
text: I would like to thank Athena and Gus and all the staff for a wonderful evening. So Greatly appreciated by me and my wife (Paul & Helen )

reviews.title: Great Venue
text: Best concert I've been to in a long time.  9$ for a tall boy... Bathrooms were clean and the sound was awesome.

reviews.title: Nice security, fer real!
text: Good gravy, I was impressed with how well this place was run.
I have gone to concerts since I could sneak out of the house.
So attending a sold out show to see Mongolian rockers the Hu Band, we made plans to grab a bite at the grill attached to the place.
The security was pleasant and dare I say it, respectful! A pleasure to deal with.
The venue is big enough for a small place and yet intimate. Lots of levels so sightlines are fair.
Steps to washrooms make it harder for mobility-challenged folks.
Merch in the one corner always. Makes it easy to find and buy swag.
Would come again.
Been to a show at least once a year for decades here.

reviews.title: Great venue to catch live bands
text: If the bar scene isn't for you, and neither is huge arenas, then the Opera House is a great place to see live bands.  Granted, you won't catch bigger bands but there is enough talent that graces this stage.  Not the class of let's say a Roy Thomson Hall, but nonetheless worthy of going there whenever a band I like happens to gig there.  But don't let the moniker fool you, there is no opera in this house.

reviews.title: Great space, but a little ramshackle
text: The auditorium itself is spectacular. I was here for the 'Lunacy' Cabaret Show which was great, but 2 hours on a plastic chair is a little much. The bar situation is annoying, it's cash or debit and if you pay with debit there's a 2 dollar surcharge.Despite all that I had a fun time and the service was good.......bring ID!!!

reviews.title: BAP NORTH AMERICA TOUR
text: Horrible horrible horrible. First of all、all sling bags that were purchased by fans that included concert goodies weren't allowed into the venue. Bap had been to 8 locations prior to this stop and not a single venue had a problem with fans bringing in their purchased goodie bags. We were told at the entrance to either bring our bags to our car/hotel or have them hang it up for $4. So the scheduled soundcheck started over half an hour late because most of the fans had to lineup again in another line to pay and put their bags away because alot of us were from out of the area. Now the concert came and went、fans just started lining up for group photos. Staff came around and told us we need to go retrieve our items because the lady was going home、her shifts over. What the f? If it's not allowed、it's not allowed. All of a sudden everyone is allowed to pick it up and go back into the venue because the staff needs to go home cause she can't sit another hour after counting all the money the venue just scammed every attendee. Call me petty for even writing this over $4、but that's not the problem. The problem is、if they allowed the bags in at the end、they should've just allowed it at the beginning. This wasted so much time starting the soundcheck and made photo session ending much much later because everyone was scurrying in line both times trying to hang their stuff up and getting their items back. Also caused the group to end their night later after they've been working so hard on this tour. They made good money. Good job scammers.

reviews.title: Steven Wilson Concert
text: This was our first visit to the Opera House and we weren't disappointed. The concert was amazing and we were able to stand in front of the soundboard where we had a great view and were perfectly positioned to experience the quadrophonic sound system that Wilson uses. Intimate venue with no seating downstairs, and very expensive drinks.

reviews.title: COOL VENUE
text: I saw a show there 2 days ago,ears still ringing,always a good sign!!!staff are great,nice touch was a bathroom assistant for towels,cologne,also liked the layout,whether you're at the back or in the pit,great views,security did not rush me out,actually quite casual about it.will be back for sure.Athena the GM was tending bar & very nice,cheers all!

reviews.title: Amazing concert venue!!
text: One of the best concert venues I've been to! It's not too big or small it's still an intimate show but not so much that there's only a few Hundred in the room! Staff are very friendly and they have great drinks at the bar as well :) will be back

reviews.title: Protest The Hero Concert
text: - Went for a Protest the Hero concert beginning of December.
- Sound quality was very good for that style of music.
- Stood at the railing between the lower level and the main bar level and it was a great view. Would recommend going early for this spot if you don't want to be in the pit.
- 2 beers came to $16.
- Merch is set up in a strange place that is in the way of the main bar and blocks the doorway.
- Very easy to get to using the TTC from downtown. (Queen East 501 Streetcar)

reviews.title: Dated building but great place to see a concert
text: This building needs some serious work. The stairs are all uneven and some are different lengths, it was a danger walking especially when the lights went out. This place looks like it's going to cave in any point. There are wires and hooks hanging from the ceiling, and it looks like there used to be a chandelier in the middle of the ceiling that was removed and they never patched up the roof after taking it down.

There were quite a few bars which was a great asset, 2 coat checks (the one on the top floor was super easy to get to because it wasn't busy). We sat up on the balcony and were able to see the whole stage and could hear well.

The only issue is that after the concert was over, there was ZERO organization. There is only 1 stairwell to leave from, and the staff basically forced everyone from the concert hall right after the show ended to start sweeping. With only 1 door open for patrons to leave from, there was a huge back log on the stairs, with people lining both sides with the railings (they were heading up to get their coats) and the only opening was the middle of the stairs to come down on. With the uneven stairs and no handrail to hold on to it was crazy to try to get down the stairs.
With the fog machines from the stage and amount of people that were in the building, there was little fresh air, they need to get a fan going or at least figure out a new ventilation system.
It was a great venue to be able to see the artist up close, but due to the poor conditions of the building and lack or organization, I doubt I would go back to see another performance here.

reviews.title: Ideal venue for concerts
text: Went last week to see Public Image Limited , last time I was here was to see George Thorogood about 30 years ago.  Only big change is that all the seats are gone.  We got in about 15 minutes after the doors opened and went right to the bar.  The lovely bartender overheard our conversation and told us to check out the balcony.  We ended up sitting on the 2nd tier dead center at these nice cocktail tables.  Awesome. And the show was damn good too.  I will come back here again , cool neighbourhood  , friendly people and great sound in an old hall.

reviews.title: Cool venue
text: Had not been to The Opera House in many years. My son saw that Albert Hammond Jr. Was playing there so we grabbed a couple of tickets. Cool spot, nicely cleaned up, tight space there where perhaps 500 there. Great sound no bad places to stand. My son is a budding rock star and he loved being able to get that close to the action. Lot's of places to grab a drink, good selection of beers and decent prices. We will be back soon

reviews.title: Do it!
text: Take a tour of this building- Interesting & prize- winning architecture! Super acoustics! I have attended 4 Great performances wirh affordable seats in the 4th ring - quite acceptable seats. Recommend!

reviews.title: \m/
text: Went here to see Motion City Soundtrack. It was a decent experience however it was very humid but had a great energy to it. The lighting next to the stairs was very poor so I'm surprised I didn't break my neck.

reviews.title: a decaying hulk
text: Went to see some Finnish metal bands here last week. the balcony was closed, but the floor was way over their allowed capacity, I thought about reporting them...sound good, sightlines okay at best. I do not think I would go back here.

reviews.title: Violent, power tripping bouncers
text: The female bouncer/front door staff are downright violent and horrible at the Opera House. A lady scratched me tonight b/c she wanted to confiscate my husband's legal medical marijuana (very small amt) that I forgot I had in my purse. He showed her his medical card, and I told her I would dispose of it and come back in without it, but she decided to rip it from my hand, and throw it in the garbage. She then told everyone around that I scratched her!! She seemed to be on a real power trip and appeared to be unstable. The whole thing completely ruined the Sun Kil Moon concert and was completely ridiculous. THEN to top it all off, my husband and I got separated, so he went outside the front door to see if I was there, forgetting that I had the tickets, and even though the lady saw him leave and he told her he was looking for me, she wouldn't let him back in b/c he didn't have his ticket. It was a terrible experience and I will never go there again.

reviews.title: Intimate concert venue!
text: Attended a general admission Rick Astley concert here in April 2018.  Doors opened at 7pm; people began lining up along the street at about 6pm, and depending on the performer, you may want to get here pretty early to line up.  There's standing room only so you need to get in there first to have a good view of the stage.   There's a little cafe attached to the Opera House where you can have a light dinner before the show, otherwise there's plenty other cafes and restaurants to choose from in the neighborhood.

reviews.title: love this venu
text: Have seen many concerts here and love this venue.
Lots of good vantage points to enjoy the shows.
Licensed and spacious they do allow you to leave and come back once sufficiently stamped.

reviews.title: Comfortable venue with excellent acoustics
text: We attended an opera.  While we passed on the lecture before the opera, it was available for those who want more background before the performance.  Wonderful bleacher-like seating for the lecture and for intermission.  A very comfortable venue.
Primary singers, especially Jane Archibald and Claire de Sevigny, dazzled.  The conductor and musicians added to a very enjoyable evening.

reviews.title: Great Venue
text: went to a concert at the Opera House, was a great show and the venue made it even better as it's small with capacity of around 900 ppl only, could easily get up and close to stage. Was no lineup to get in, had a coat check  ($4) and beer was reasonably priced at $9 tallcans compared to 12-15 at other venues. Sound is great, stage is a little small, there's a balcony up top. one large bar at the back and 2 smaller bars on floor area... only negative thing is bathrooms are wayyy in the basement. Great place to see metal show would go again for sure!

reviews.title: Food, ambiance and staff are great
text: Was looking for Pub food but a bit more gastronomic and it wass exactly what I was looking for. The place is beautiful, the staff is friendly and the music is great. I'll go back on my next trip for sure!

reviews.title: Rocking out for years here!
text: This is one of the best places to still catch a live show. So many bands have played here and I still love it. A venue that can handle just under 1000, it has hosted so many bands that have gone on to further renown.
Tonight, I saw Hammerfall and Delain.

Where else can you see bands that usually play stadiums in Europe, yet get to see them intimately because they have a cult following here, but not enough presence in North American markets...so lucky!
Staff are quick and it's a bar, no fancy cocktails here. Washrooms are in the basement.
A fast-food grill beside and attached to the venue, which serves a decadent burger for about ten bucks.
Never too old to rock and roll. Live shows range in prices depending on the band.

reviews.title: Live Music Venue
text: Went to see the Jayhawks. It was my first time at this Toronto iconic venue. Small, intimate place. Drink prices were reasonable. Parking nearby. Has an old Toronto feel and it was fine for what we saw.

reviews.title: It was decent
text: We recently attended a show at the Opera House. The venue itself is oldish. They have 2 bars on the main floor and one on the upper. We paid extra for the "vip" seating on the balcony.. What a disappointment. There is very minimal seating and uif you don't get there right as the doors open you're stuck at the back and can't even see the show. Coat check is another like 2 small flights of stairs up from the bar on the balcony.. We ended up staying on the main floor the whole event; shouldn't of wasted the money. Also be aware 99% of the venue is standing

reviews.title: Burlesque show was awesome and entertaining
text: Attended the opera house for the burlesque show. The sound was good the venue was suitable for the show.  The bar was there and the bathrooms were reasonable.   Filled up pretty quickly for the show. Would go back again for another show
